description.value:
Trigger A creature touches the console directly or with a tool

Effect The haunt distracts the user with colorful graphics and interesting data while lowering their mental defenses. The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:22] save. The trap then rolls initiative.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Stupefied]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is stupefied 1.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Stupefied]{Stupefied 2}. Additionally, they are @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Fascinated] with the computer and can't take any actions except to passively view the data on the computer. At the end of each of their turns, they can retry this saving throw to remove the fascinated condition.

details.description: A ghostly hacker haunts their computer and attempts to drain the spirit of anyone who accessed the computer.
details.disable: @Check[computers|dc:16] (trained) to partition the haunted code, or @Check[religion|dc:18] (trained) or Occultism (trained) to exorcise the spirit
details.routine: (1 action) The haunt absorbs the spirits of the living, dealing @Damage[(1d10+4)[spirit]] damage to all living creatures within 10 feet of the computer (@Check[will|dc:18|basic] save). On a critical failure, a creature is additionally @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Drained]{Drained 1}. This routine doesn't count as a hostile action for the purposes of ending the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Fascinated] condition.
